item.title: Is Mobility Killing Your Company?
item.description:
Initially, only a few executives used company cell phones, which made sense for accessibility. However, this practice expanded to various levels of management, ultimately leading to company-issued smartphones for everyone. While this enhanced communication and response time, it resulted in a complex network of individual contracts and bills due to a phased implementation. Consequently, managing numerous contracts and potentially unused devices became a challenge. Instead of handling this burden, businesses can outsource wireless cost control to specialized companies...
